titleStmt.title: By the King wee haue since our entry into this realme of England, had special care to make all our subiects know, with how equall affection we resolued to proceede in all things which should concerne the safetie or honor of our kingdomes ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Robert Barker, Printer to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: For equal execution of justice for English and Scots offenders.
Other title information from first 3 lines of text.
"Giuen at our Castle of Windsore the eight day of Iuly, 1603. in the first yeere of our Reigne of England, France, and Ireland, And of Scotland the sixe and thirtieth."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
